Breeding adult (American).description: Herring Gulls and other gull species have broader wings and looser, slower wingbeats than Northern Fulmars. Adult Herring Gulls have dark wingtips which light-morph fulmars lack. Gulls also lack the fulmar's tubenose.

Juvenile (American).description: Herring Gulls and other gull species have broader wings and looser, slower wingbeats than Northern Fulmars. Juvenile Herring Gulls have more contrasting plumage, with dark tail and wingtips, than dark morph fulmars.

Adult/immature.description: Pink-footed Shearwaters are more slender than Northern Fulmars with a longer, thinner bill. They have a dark head and pale throat, whereas light-morph fulmars have all-white heads and dark-morph fulmars have all dark-head and underparts.
Sooty Shearwaters are more slender with a longer, thinner, darker bill than Northern Fulmars.
